intro: Marsdenia zehntneri, commonly known as the Zehntner's Marsdenia, is a climbing shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by follicles containing seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
